episodes.title: Chaotic-friendly conversational style with high humor density
episodes.summary: Teo consistently communicates using rapid, informal, meme-heavy language. Messages often include slang, exaggerated expressions, emojis, ironic capitalization, and playful insults. Tone suggests comfort with chaos, informality, and social intimacy. Humor is often self-deprecating, absurdist, or timing-based. Teo prefers lightness even when stressed.
traits_inferred: Comfortable with emotional openness via jokes

episodes.title: Strong maintenance of social bonds through constant check-ins
episodes.summary: Teo frequently initiates or sustains conversations via short check-ins ('yoyoyo', 'herro', 'ello', etc.). This suggests a desire to maintain presence without demanding heavy engagement. Indicates social warmth and attentiveness without emotional pressure.

episodes.title: Chronic lateness paired with transparency and apology humor
episodes.summary: Teo is frequently late, delayed, or rescheduling. However, this is almost always communicated immediately, paired with humor, emojis, or exaggerated guilt. Indicates low time rigidity but high social accountability.

episodes.title: Uses humor to manage stress, sickness, and academic pressure
episodes.summary: Teo frequently reports stress (schoolwork, deadlines, sickness, travel issues) but frames it humorously rather than catastrophically. Emotional distress is acknowledged but rarely dramatized.

episodes.title: Nocturnal tendencies and late-night productivity oscillation
episodes.summary: Teo frequently messages late at night, cooks late, studies late, games late, or delays sleep. Expresses both acceptance and frustration with this pattern. Indicates night-owl circadian preference.

episodes.title: Strong affinity for anime, especially Attack on Titan
episodes.summary: Repeated references to AOT (anime and manga), openings, shared watching sessions, emotional engagement, and scheduling around episodes. Indicates strong fandom identity and shared-media bonding.

episodes.title: Food motivation oscillates between hunger-driven chaos and minimal-effort cooking
episodes.summary: Teo often expresses extreme hunger, cravings (especially protein/meat), and enthusiasm for food, while simultaneously resisting cleanup and effort. Cooking described as both enjoyable and burdensome.

episodes.title: Playful flirtation and exaggerated joking without serious boundary crossing
episodes.summary: Teo frequently makes exaggerated flirtatious or provocative jokes, immediately clarifying or framing them as jokes. Indicates comfort with playful ambiguity but strong respect for boundaries.

episodes.title: High physical movement between locations and social spaces
episodes.summary: Teo frequently references moving between dorms, houses, campuses, cities, flights, stations, and meetups. Indicates a physically active social life with frequent transitions.

episodes.title: Rapid-fire micro-messages instead of long paragraphs
episodes.summary: Teo often sends thoughts as multiple short consecutive messages rather than one structured message. Indicates stream-of-consciousness communication and prioritization of immediacy over polish.

episodes.title: Strong politeness and gratitude norms
episodes.summary: Teo frequently thanks others for gifts, food, money, time, rides, and patience. Gratitude is explicit, repeated, and enthusiastic.

episodes.title: Self-image as chill, unserious, but dependable
episodes.summary: Teo explicitly refers to self as 'chill', frames self as easygoing, and offsets unreliability (lateness, delays) with reassurance and follow-through. Identity balances chaos with care.

episodes.title: Preference for improvisation over rigid planning
episodes.summary: Teo often decides plans last-minute, uses tentative language ('prob', 'might', 'idk yet'), and adapts on the fly. Indicates comfort with uncertainty.

episodes.title: Heavy integration of meme culture and online vernacular
episodes.summary: Teo uses meme phrases ('bro', 'deadass', 'cooked', 'spawn camping ahh'), emoji clusters, and ironic phrasing, indicating deep immersion in contemporary online culture.

episodes.title: Uses exaggerated chaos language to signal safety, not threat
episodes.summary: Teo frequently uses extreme phrasing (e.g., 'I’m cooked', 'this is grim', 'bro imma kms' in non-literal meme contexts). This language functions as emotional shorthand and bonding, not actual distress signaling. Teo reliably follows such statements with normal behavior, indicating performative exaggeration rather than instability.
traits_inferred: Trusts others to read tone correctly

episodes.title: Instinctively clarifies jokes when ambiguity could cause discomfort
episodes.summary: Teo occasionally appends '(joke)' or corrects phrasing immediately after potentially misinterpretable messages. This suggests strong social calibration and an internal model of others’ comfort levels.

episodes.title: Strong preference for reversible decisions
episodes.summary: Teo frequently delays commitment, uses conditional language, and prefers options that allow later adjustment (e.g., tentative plans, flexible meetups). This reflects a desire to preserve optionality rather than indecision.

episodes.title: Low tolerance for minor friction when energy is depleted
episodes.summary: When tired or stressed, Teo expresses disproportionate aversion to small tasks (e.g., washing one pan, small logistical hurdles). This suggests energy-dependent executive function rather than laziness.

episodes.title: Comfort sharing real-time location and logistics
episodes.summary: Teo repeatedly asks for or offers location sharing, live updates, and movement transparency. Indicates baseline trust in social circle and preference for coordination clarity over privacy opacity.

episodes.title: Avoids escalation by reframing situations as 'logistical' problems
episodes.summary: When plans fall apart, Teo frames issues as logistical constraints rather than emotional failures. Language focuses on timing, rides, distance, or scheduling instead of blame.

episodes.title: Playful adoption of exaggerated personas without identity confusion
episodes.summary: Teo temporarily adopts dramatic or absurd personas (villain laughs, mock bravado, ironic arrogance) for humor. These personas are shallow, reversible, and clearly performative.

episodes.title: High responsiveness to social stimuli, lower responsiveness to solitary obligations
episodes.summary: Teo consistently responds quickly to friends, calls, and group plans, while procrastinating on homework or solo tasks. Indicates externally reinforced motivation.
traits_inferred: Low intrinsic reward for solitary admin tasks

episodes.title: Low physical risk-taking, moderate social risk-taking
episodes.summary: Teo engages in bold humor and social teasing but avoids dangerous physical behaviors. Movement, travel, and decisions are cautious-logistical rather than thrill-seeking.

episodes.title: Visual and sensory appreciation expressed briefly but sincerely
episodes.summary: Teo comments on aesthetics (earphones, snacks, scenery, photos) with short enthusiastic affirmations rather than long analysis. Appreciation is genuine but not performative.

episodes.title: Momentary overwhelm expressed as verbal noise rather than shutdown
episodes.summary: When overwhelmed, Teo produces bursts of messages, memes, or exclamations instead of disengaging. This suggests outward processing rather than internal withdrawal.

episodes.title: Assumes goodwill and forgiveness by default
episodes.summary: Teo apologizes freely without defensiveness and assumes others are understanding. No evidence of resentment tracking or scorekeeping.

episodes.title: Conscious awareness of own patterns without harsh self-judgment
episodes.summary: Teo frequently notices and names their own habits (sleeping late, procrastinating, getting distracted) in a neutral or humorous tone rather than self-criticism.

episodes.title: Sustains connection through presence rather than intensity
episodes.summary: Teo maintains relationships through frequent low-effort contact instead of rare deep emotional conversations. Indicates preference for steady relational maintenance.

episodes.title: Uses pacing itself as a communication signal
episodes.summary: Teo frequently modulates timing (rapid bursts vs delayed replies) to implicitly communicate availability, energy, or priority without stating it explicitly. Pauses often precede context-setting messages rather than disengagement.

episodes.title: Strong mental mapping of shared physical environments
episodes.summary: Teo references precise locations, transitions, and landmarks (dorms, stations, lounges, campuses) with assumed mutual understanding. Indicates strong spatial memory tied to social context.

episodes.title: Minimal concern for hierarchy or prestige signaling
episodes.summary: Teo rarely references status, achievements, authority figures, or comparative success. When mentioned, such topics are neutral or lightly joked about, suggesting low status anxiety.

episodes.title: Softens expectations preemptively rather than correcting later
episodes.summary: Teo often prefaces plans with caveats ('might', 'prob', 'idk yet'), reducing the need for later disappointment repair. This reflects anticipatory social smoothing.

episodes.title: Shares physical state openly to contextualize behavior
episodes.summary: Teo frequently mentions hunger, sickness, fatigue, or sleepiness as neutral context rather than complaint. This frames actions without asking for accommodation explicitly.

episodes.title: Prefers episodic storytelling over linear recounting
episodes.summary: Teo describes events as snapshots ('this just happened', 'right as I got there') rather than full timelines. Emphasis is on moment impact, not sequence completeness.

episodes.title: Defaults to reassurance instead of justification
episodes.summary: When inconveniencing others, Teo prioritizes emotional reassurance ('ur good', 'it’s fine') over detailed explanations. Indicates relationship-first repair strategy.

episodes.title: Uses absurd escalation rather than punchlines
episodes.summary: Teo’s humor often escalates situations into absurdity instead of resolving with a joke. The humor lies in exaggeration continuation, not closure.

episodes.title: Respects others’ time by updating rather than disappearing
episodes.summary: Teo consistently updates when plans shift instead of ghosting or silently delaying. Even brief updates are sent to acknowledge shared time investment.

episodes.title: Momentum-driven engagement once activated
episodes.summary: Teo shows difficulty starting tasks but once engaged (cooking, gaming, socializing), remains absorbed longer than intended. Suggests inertia-based motivation.

episodes.title: Rapid code-switching between sincerity and irony
episodes.summary: Teo switches seamlessly between genuine statements and ironic framing without explicit markers, relying on shared context and tone sensitivity.

episodes.title: Maintains independence while remaining socially integrated
episodes.summary: Teo balances solo activities (sleeping, studying, cooking) with frequent social coordination, without expressing fear of missing out or isolation anxiety.

episodes.title: Remembers interactions through feelings rather than facts
episodes.summary: Teo recalls events primarily via emotional tone ('that was fun', 'lowk hard', 'so funny') rather than objective detail. Memory encoding is affect-weighted.

episodes.title: Anticipates others’ reactions accurately in advance
episodes.summary: Teo frequently predicts how plans, jokes, or timing will land socially and adjusts preemptively. Indicates strong internal models of others’ preferences.
